item.title: Best Black Friday Deals for Xbox Series X|S
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-black-friday-deals-for-xbox-series-xs/

Ready for Black Friday? With Christmas just around the corner, many gamers are trying to grab the best deals possible. Like every year, Xbox has quite a few deals people can choose from. Here are the best Black Friday Deals for Xbox Series X|S.

Best Xbox Series X|S Black Friday Deals

Excited to find the best Xbox Series X|S deals this Black Friday? Well, Xbox will be doing quite a few deals for Xbox Series X|S systems, controllers and games.

However, no actual Black Friday deals have been released by the company, many are already speculating that the system will have huge bundle deals at stores like Walmart, Target, Best Buy and more.

Every year, too, many of these popular retail stores have a bunch of different discounts on games. With popular titles like Call of Duty just releasing a new game, gamers should expect to see deals revolving around the games to release on Black Friday.

Current Xbox Series X|S Deals

Luckily, Xbox has a ton of deals already in its store, meaning gamers can indulge in the Black Friday festivities early on. Below is a list of current Xbox deals gamers can grab in the Microsoft store:

  • Xbox Series X ($50 off)

The page also has quite a few games for sale, too. However, the majority of these games for sale are not big titles. The big titles, like Call of Duty and more, will not be released until Black Friday.

How to Get Black Friday Deals

Luckily, Black Friday deals are not as difficult to come by as they were in the past when you had to wait outside a store until midnight. Many retailers, like Walmart and Target, will release their deals earlier in the day on Thanksgiving, giving consumers the chance to grab whatever their heart desires early on.

Still, many deals, especially on Xbox games and systems, will go incredibly fast, so be prepared to have your money out.

For more Insider Gaming guides, check out the best Black Friday Nintendo Switch deals.

item.title: Best Black Friday Deals for PS5
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-black-friday-deals-for-ps5/

Black Friday is just a few weeks away, and gamers are already trying to get the best deals for PS5s, PS5 games and more. Here is a list of the best Black Friday deals for PS5s.

Best PS5 Black Friday Deals

Earlier, PlayStation accidentally leaked that it may be including a PS5 Slim deal on Black Friday, which would be a huge win for those looking to purchase the popular system. The leak revealed that the PS5 Slim would be brought down to $379.99 USD on Black Friday, which is $70 cheaper than regular.

However, there have been no actual released Black Friday deals for PlayStation yet, but there are plenty of early Black Friday PS5 deals to hop on.

Early Black Friday Deals

At the moment, PlayStation has already released quite a few different deals, including discounts on systems, controllers games and more.

Below is a list of PlayStation equipment players can buy for a discount ahead of Black Friday:

  • DualSense Wireless Controller – Cosmic Red
  • PS5 DualSense Edge controller
  • ‘EA Sports FC 25’, PS5
  • PS5 Digital Slim

Many other sites include potential deals, too, so keep your eye out when web surfing. There will also be quite a few deals in stores, too.

PS5 Black Friday Predictions

While we do not know of too many PlayStation deals yet, could only be assumed that a variety of PS5 bundles will be on sale.

Also, many stores usually include sales of games, including Walmart, Amazon, Target, Best Buy and more. One game to watch out for is Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, as the game seems to always drop in price for Black Friday every year.

Your best bet is to keep your eye out on websites and stores as more and more will begin releasing PS5 Black Friday information soon.

For more Insider Gaming guides, read about the best Black Friday deals for Nintendo Switch.

item.title: PWHL Coming To EA Sports NHL 25
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pwhl-coming-to-ea-sports-nhl-25/

EA Sports and the Professional Women’s Hockey League (PWHL) have announced that the league will be coming to NHL 25 in December.

Starting December 5, all six PWHL teams — Boston Fleet, Minnesota Frost, Montréal Victoire, New York Sirens, Ottawa Charge, and Toronto Sceptres — will be added to the game to play in a number of modes. Those include Play Now, Online Versus, Shootout and Season. In addition to being playable in modes, PWHL content will be added to the World of Chel as well Hockey Ultimate Team (HUT).

The launch comes alongside the start of the PWHL’s second season.

“We are thrilled to bring the PWHL into NHL 25 as part of a massive holiday update, giving players all-new ways to play, starting in a couple of days with the frenetic energy of NHL Arcade through to the launch of 4 Nations Face-Off in the New Year,” NHL 25 Executive Producer Bill Dollar said.

Women’s hockey has been a growing presence in the EA Sports NHL series for a number of years with international teams being a part of the last handful of games. The PWHL marks the first women’s league to be added to the franchise. In the past, EA Sports did speak with the NWHL about possible inclusion, but no deal was ever reached.

As far as this update is concerned, not all likenesses will be scanned and into the game when the update comes. That said, there is a plan to add more via updates to NHL 25.

In addition to the PWHL, EA Sports announced that the Four Nations Tournament and a new Arcade mode are both coming to NHL 25.

What do you think of the PWHL coming to NHL 25? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the 16 games coming to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in November. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
